models

Class Personnage

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.Personnage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Chef, Soldat

    public abstract class Personnage
extends Object
    Defines a base character's data and behaviors.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int force
      The character's hitting force (if any).
      private int id
      The character's identifier.
      private boolean isChef
      Whether this character type is a chef.
      private String nom
      The character' names.
      private int vie
      The character's current life (begins with 100).

    • Constructor Summary

      Initialize a base character's data.

    • Field Detail

      • force

        private final int force
        The character's hitting force (if any).

      • id

        private final int id
        The character's identifier.

      • isChef

        private final boolean isChef
        Whether this character type is a chef. A base character is not a chef by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • nom

        private final String nom
        The character' names.

      • vie

        private int vie
        The character's current life (begins with 100).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Personnage

        protected Personnage(int id,
                     String nom,
                     int force)
        Initialize a base character's data.
        Parameters:
        id - Their identifier.
        nom - Their names.
        force - Their hitting force.

    • Method Detail

      • estMort

        public boolean estMort()
        Whether the character is dead or not.
        Returns:
        True if the character has no more life points (or is negative).

      • frapper

        public void frapper(Personnage cible)
             throws SourceMorteException,
                    CibleMorteException
        Instructs the character to hit a given target.
        Parameters:
        cible - The target to hit.
        Throws:
        SourceMorteException - Happens when this character is dead, they can't hit when being dead.
        CibleMorteException - Happens when the target to hit is dead, they cannot be hit when dead.

      • getForce

        public int getForce()
        Retrieves the character's force.
        Returns:
        The character's force.

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Retrieves the character's identifier.
        Returns:
        The character's identifier.

      • getNom

        public String getNom()
        Retrieves the character' names.
        Returns:
        The character' names.

      • getVie

        public int getVie()
        Retrieves the character's current life.
        Returns:
        The character's current life.

      • isChef

        public boolean isChef()
        Looks whether the character is a chef or not.
        Returns:
        True if the character is dead.

      • seFaireFrapper

        protected void seFaireFrapper(Personnage source)
                       throws CibleMorteException
        The base definition for receiving a hit from a given source. This will reduce the character's life by the source's force amount.
        Parameters:
        source - The character that wants to hit this character.
        Throws:
        CibleMorteException - Happens when this character is dead, they can no longer be hit, once dead.

      • seFaireSupprimer

        public String seFaireSupprimer()
        A method that clean up the character whenever invoked for proper deletion.
        Returns:
        A custom message, if any.

      • sePresenter

        public String sePresenter()
        The base introduction of a character. This returns the following base format: {id}:\t{full_name} ma vie est de {remaining_life} In addition, it shows the character's force, if any (non-zero and positive).
        Returns:
        The character's base introduction text.
        See Also:
        getId(), getVie(), getNom()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        String representation of the character, shows their names.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The character' names.

      • tuer

        public void tuer()
        Instructs the character to kill themselves.
